original_title: Sri Lanka’s mid day shares gain on IMF and currency appreciation
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares gained in mid day trade, purely run on speculations of the International Monetary Fund coming to its conclusion and likely rate cuts from the Monetary Policy Review, an analyst said.
“The market was moving on a positive sentiment based on IMF and it was also seen that the currency appreciated,” analyst said.

Sri Lanka rupee at 338/339 to the US dollar on Friday up from 243/348 a day earlier in the spot market as the rupee continued to move up after a surrender rule was relaxed making more dollars available to the market.
All Share Price Index was up 1.17 percent or 109.4 points to 9,443.23, while the most liquid index S&P SL20 was up 0.47 percent or 13.38 points to 2,841.26.
The market generated a revenue of 2.4 billion rupees as at 1230 hours.
Top gainers were Commercial Bank, Sampath Bank and DFCC Bank.
Banks and retail indexes were an attractive index for investors solely based on positive speculations on the IMF. (Colombo/Mar03/2023)
